intro: Erysimum candicum, commonly known as the yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers, which bloom in spring, are borne in racemes and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erysimum candicum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
